meaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> is the <radical>same</radical> as a <kanji>cave</kanji>. Because, if a wave is big enough, it will curl over on itself, creating a sort of cave within the wave. That's why it's the same as a cave!
readingMnemonic: Best way to remember the reading for this kanji is to think about how the shape of a cave is the shape of a <reading>dou</reading>ghnut (どう).
